Key Arguments: The volume of new content is too vast for ACMA to effectively monitor.
There is a risk of false positives, where content is incorrectly flagged as misinformation.
The integrity and reputation of ACMA could be compromised if it makes incorrect judgments.
The pressure on content providers to avoid misinformation could stifle beneficial information.
Historical examples, such as the COVID-19 vaccine discussions, show that the truth can be complex and not immediately clear.
Main Themes: Potential negative consequences of the legislation
Complexity and evolving nature of truth in information
Notable Quotes: The amount of new content is so vast that ACMA cannot possibly be across all of it.
It will force content providers to make judgements that are not always possible.
ACMAâ€™s reputation will be severely damaged if it follows up on a specific issue and is then shown to be wrong.
